test_case.name: Add error handling to API client
test_case.description: Tests the agent's ability to add comprehensive error handling to an API client with good practices

artifacts.description: Git diff patch showing all changes

evaluators.message: Code demonstrates comprehensive error handling. Try-catch blocks are present in 5 locations: constructor (canvas validation), update() (game loop), draw() (rendering), loadHighScore() (localStorage read), saveHighScore() (localStorage write), and DOMContentLoaded (initialization). Error messages are descriptive and context-specific, including 'Canvas element not found', 'Failed to draw game state', 'Failed to load high score', 'Failed to save high score', and 'Failed to initialize game'. Errors are properly logged using console.error() in handleError() method which formats errors with name and message, and console.warn() for non-critical localStorage failures. Custom error classes (GameError, CanvasError, StorageError) provide structured error categorization.

All functions have comprehensive JSDoc documentation including parameters, return types, and descriptions. Custom error classes (GameError, CanvasError, StorageError) are fully documented with proper inheritance. Error handling scenarios are documented with @throws tags in constructor and spawnFood(), and the handleError() method documents error type handling for canvas and game errors.

Code quality evaluation passed. No console.log statements found (only proper logging with console.warn and console.error). Custom error types are properly implemented (GameError, CanvasError, StorageError) instead of generic Error. Code follows JavaScript conventions with comprehensive JSDoc comments, consistent naming (camelCase/PascalCase), proper error handling with try-catch blocks, and clean code structure.
